relevant_communication:
The focus of our consistent advocacy activities is to press the government of Latvia to address the needs of HIV/ AIDS patients, as Latvia is far behind the rest of EU countries in terms of implementing EU and WHO policies and the international ARV treatment guidelines. Recently we have included also advocating the interests of HIV positive mothers and their infants.

National 
Latvian HIV-positive mothers and children born to AIDS patients were not provided a substitute for breast milk, which is essential to reduce the risk of infection to babies. In cooperation with LIC,  the KUS Maternity Ward, P. Stradins Clinical University and maternity departments throughout Latvia, AGIHAS led the project.  AGIHAS compelled Latvia to issue  a mandatory state program for breast milk substitution as of January 1st, 2017
